You've been unsubscribed from the flashcard email series. No hard feelings!

Before you go, here are some resources you might still find useful:

## The Evals FAQ

I've been teaching evals to over 3,000 students, and these are the questions that keep coming up. If you're working with LLMs, there's a good chance you'll find something helpful here.

[Download the PDF](https://hamel.dev/blog/posts/evals-faq/evals-faq.pdf){target="_blank"}

## Beyond Naive RAG

There's been a lot of "RAG is dead" talk floating around. I disagree. This guide covers advanced retrieval techniques that actually work in practice.

[Download the PDF](https://hamel.dev/notes/llm/rag/beyond-naive-rag.pdf){target="_blank"}

## The Flashcards (Yes, Really)

Look, you opted out of the emails. I get it. But the flashcards themselves are still useful, and I'd rather share them freely than gatekeep. The emails have extra commentary, memes, and other stuff, but if you just want the cards, here they are:

[View the Flashcards](https://hamel.dev/notes/llm/evals/flashcards/){target="_blank"}
